availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Aquilla Young (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer, hotelkeeper, and gentleman)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, soldier, hotelkeeper, and gentleman. North Carolina native. Married to Elizabeth C. Rogers Young. Father of Mary J. Young Daniel, Henry Young, Adaline Young, James C. Young, and Mary Louisa Young Anderson. Served in the War of 1812 in Dudley's Mounted Battalion, Kentucky Volunteers, as a private from 1813 to 1814. Hotelkeeper in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Owned at least two enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1852. Gentleman in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Montgomery County in 1860. Household owned an additional seven enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860.
